StringsInsufficientHexLength(uint256,uin.details: The `value` string doesn't fit in the specified `length`.

params.collectionLength: Number of tokens in the collection

params.owner: Contains the address which balance we want to verify

returns._0: uint256 with the current balance of the account

createProduct(string,uint256).details: This function is only available to an account with a `CREATOR` role

params._copies: Amount of tokens inside the product
params._productName: Name of the product to create

params.collectionId: Index of the collection that we want to loop
params.endingIndex: Index of the last token of the product
params.startingIndex: Index of the starting token of the product

returns.nextIndex: With the next starting point available for new products

params.productIndex_: Contains the id of the product that we want to verify

returns._0: product which contain the information of the product

params.productIndex: Index of the collection to search

returns._0: bool 				Which respond if the tokens belongs or not to a product and a range

ownsTokenInRange(address,uint256).details: This function require that the range exist

params.productIndex_: Contains the index of the collection where is the token
params.tokenIndex_: Contains the index of the token inside the collection

returns._0: uint		  With the value of the token in that indexed position

tokenByProduct(uint256,uint256).details: This function require that the collection exist

params.productIndex_: Contains the index of the collection where is the token
params.tokenIndex_: Contains the index of the token inside the collection

returns._0: uint		  With the value of the token in that indexed position

tokenToProduct(uint256).details: This function require that the token exist

params.tokenIndex_: Contains the index of the token which info we want to know

returns.productIndex: With the corresponding collection ID for the token
returns.rangeIndex: With the corresponding range of the collection
